titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the May B. Woodward scrapbook 1977.292
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-10T14:10-0500

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: May (or Mae) B. Woodward was the daughter of John B. Woodward (1835-1896), a well-respected Brooklyn businessman involved in the import-export trade in South America. John B. Woodward also served in the Brooklyn-based 13th Regiment of the New York National Guard, was Adjutant General of New York State, and was a mayoral candidate in Brooklyn in 1885.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One scrapbook compiled by May B. Woodward and containing programs and other ephemera from various Brooklyn social organizations, sports and recreational clubs, charities, and theatrical productions. Included are materials from the Brooklyn Athletic Association, the Apollo Club, the Brooklyn Academy of Music, the Park Theatre (also known as the New Park Theatre or Colonel Sinn's New Park Theatre), and the Lyceum Theatre. Items span 1884 to 1896, though most date from 1886 and 1887.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); May B. Woodward scrapbook, 1977.292, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
